channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How De’Longhi Dodged Tariffs by Labeling Its Coffee Machine as a Computer
item.description: It’s a bold strategy to take when considering the high penalties companies face if they get caught knowingly underpaying a duty.

item.title: Holiday spending is expected to drop this year—led by sharpest decline from Gen Z
item.description: U.S. consumers, particularly Gen Z, are likely to spend significantly less on the holidays this year, according to a new PricewaterhouseCoopers survey...

item.title: Want to Learn From Palantir Co-Founder Peter Thiel? Listen to Him Talk About the Antichrist
item.description: Peter Thiel will be giving a four-part lecture series on the Antichrist. It could serve as a devilishly useful primer on the investor’s worldview.

item.title: How executives can fast-track their impact in the first 90 days
item.description: Your first 90 days as an executive set the tone for your reputation, relationships, and results. During this period, the board, C-suite, and peers are...

item.title: Rural towns are handing out $10,000 relocation bonuses to poach high-earning remote workers
item.description: Forget corporate tax breaks. Cities now pay remote workers to move in.

item.title: Sexual Harassment Still Plagues the Workplace. Here’s How to Fight Back
item.description: When it comes to combating upsetting office interactions, research says you could learn from your female staff.

item.title: McDonald’s CEO is grappling with a ‘two-tier economy’ as he slashes prices on value meals—and signals backing for a minimum wage increase
item.description: “Particularly with middle- and lower-income consumers, they’re feeling under a lot of pressure right now,” Chris Kempczinski said on CNBC.

item.title: Oracle lays off thousands—or more—globally amid rapid AI shifts
item.description: Employees at tech giant Oracle are facing down a fresh round of layoffs this month, the latest bad news out of an industry that’s either booming or br...

item.title: Trump says the video of garbage bags dropped out of a White House window was AI-generated, ironically adding, people ‘blame AI’ to cover up bad things
item.description: Despite the president’s denial, the video remains authentic, according to multiple officials.

item.title: Florida moves to end all vaccine mandates, including for schoolchildren
item.description: Florida plans to become the first state in the country to eliminate all vaccine mandates, including for schoolchildren, state Surgeon General Joseph L...

item.title: Instagram Finally Gave Us an iPad App. It’s Not What Anyone Asked For
item.description: Instagram users aren’t happy with the apps insistence on making you start with Reels.

item.title: After Months of Worry Over Tariffs, Business Owners Now Feel More Confident
item.description: New surveys find entrepreneurs cautiously optimistic about their business prospects and the economy.

item.title: Super Bowl ad spots that cost millions a piece already sold out even though the event is still more than 150 days away
item.description: NBCUniversal, which has the rights to next February’s Super Bowl, has entirely sold out ad inventory during the big game.

item.title: One out of every 4 homes is at ‘severe or extreme’ climate risk, study says
item.description: Some $12.7 trillion of Americans' housing wealth is exposed to the climate change crisis.

item.title: Trump administration may block another offshore wind farm
item.description: President Donald Trump’s administration is reconsidering federal approval of Avangrid’s planned New England Wind project off the coast of Massachusett...

item.title: Fed officials struggle to explain slowing economy, adding to rate-cut prospects
Nasdaq, S&P 500 end higher on Big Tech rally, while Dow lags and closes lower
Markets entering a new ‘postmodern’ era, Goldman says. How investors can win.
